::Spears::

She jumped into the seat next to Striker with a look of terror on her 
face. "This is not fun. I've had fun and this is not it. If the Matix 
intended me to fly, it would have selected a winged creature for me 
to be."
She pulled herself up into the chair and hugged herself.
She thought a moment, with her head down on her knees, "If the solar 
collector won't work, well, isn't there a back up pack of energon 
that is used for just such emergencies?" she said as she cringes in 
the chair

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> ::Striker::
> 
> Striker presses a few more buttons, the pod ceasing to shake. "The 
trip there 
> took too much energy, and it had too little time to recharge. We'll 
need to 
> touch down for a short while."
> 
> Striker presses a few more buttons, the pod steeply dropping toward 
the ocean 
> and then leveling out right above it. Striker sits back in a chair. 
He frowns 
> as he hears a booming sound.
> 
> "Weather report."
> 
> The console beeps at the order, giving the readings of a storm.
> 
> "Great," Striker says, looking at the reading, "This is going to be 
a bumpy 
> ride."
